definition: to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle

sentences.english: I would rather be scolded than cheat (others).
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿挨骂不愿欺骗人。

sentences.english: She was scolded for the disorderliness of her room.
sentences.chinese: 她因为她的房间乱七八糟而挨骂。

sentences.english: Afraid of being scolded, the naughty boy ran away without turning off the water.
sentences.chinese: 害怕挨骂，那个淘气的男孩没关水龙头就跑了。

sentences.english: The windowpane was broken by the child; he will certainly be scolded.
sentences.chinese: 窗上的玻璃叫那个孩子打破了，他肯定要挨骂的。

sentences.english: Rafael was scolded even though he hadnt been doing anything wrong.
sentences.chinese: 尽管拉斐尔没做什么错事，但他还是挨骂了。

sentences.english: Rafael was scolded even though he hadn't been doing anything wrong.
sentences.chinese: 尽管拉斐尔没做什么错事，但他还是挨骂了。

sentences.english: You will catch it for breaking that vase .
sentences.chinese: 你打破了那花瓶要挨骂了。

sentences.english: It was no less scolded, but we don't care.
sentences.chinese: 想想小时候是没少挨骂的，不过我们都不在意。

sentences.english: Afraid of being scolded, for a moment, little Franz thought of truant.
sentences.chinese: 因为害怕挨骂，小弗朗兹一时起了逃学的念头。

sentences.english: Afraid of being scolded, for a moment, little Franz thought of playing truant.
sentences.chinese: 由于害怕挨骂，小弗朗兹一时起了逃学的念头。

sentences.english: Ordway was prepared to be hopped on for so late homing.
sentences.chinese: 这么晚回家，奥德韦已做好了挨骂的准备。

sentences.english: When my father was a child he suffered hunger and cold and was often cursed and beaten.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸小时候忍饥受寒，还经常挨打挨骂。

sentences.english: You will catch it for breaking that vase.
sentences.chinese: 你打破了那花瓶要挨骂了。

sentences.english: If the teacher sees you doing that, you'll catch it.
sentences.chinese: 要是老师发明你这样做，你会挨骂的。

sentences.english: They were fre-quently cursed in those days.
sentences.chinese: 在那个时候他们常常挨骂。

sentences.english: When we passed his house, we heard his daughter scolded.
sentences.chinese: 从他家经过时，咱们听见他女儿挨骂。
